header.title: Sámi dialogue based language learning system: Design document

section.title: Sentence parser
section.p: The system is able to parse sentences, also incorrect ones. At the moment, there is an analyzator and disambiguator and we are able to get full syntactic analysis of the sentences that belong to the language. Is it possible to parse also sentences which contain errors? There are two classes of errors: spelling errors and grammatical errors. The spelling errors can be recognized by the speller, which can suggest an alternative. (the user has to be able to select the alternative she wants). The grammatical errors are words in wrong forms. The grammatical analysis should be such that the words receive an analysis although they belong to an ungrammatical sentence. The suggestion mechanism for grammatical errors is described below.

section.title: Tutorial dialogue
section.p: The system gives feedback and makes suggestions on the basis of errors produced by the user. The sentence-frames for the feedback are created beforehand, such as "Did you mean ___?", or "Perhaps you meant ___ or ___ or ?", what other frames are there?

section.title: Sentence generator
section.p: The sentence generator is part of the dialogue system. It does not involve any semantic representation, but the words and correct forms are provided by the dialogue system.

section.title: Speller
section.p: Speller for North and Lule Sámi will be used in correcting spelling errors by the user.
